content.raw:
I agree with the transport library concerns. In this situation sensor and physics run in the same process, and as far as I can tell this is currently fast and reliable. The data needed by a sensor is also sporadic, except for time.

A model and world plugin can get a pointer to a sensor using `sensors::get_sensor()`. As long a the plugin links against the sensor library, and doesn't behave improperly, everything should be fine.
